metadata.title: Fall 2024 Winner Jennifer Guzman Millan - Vasquez Law Firm, PLLC
metadata.ogTitle: Fall 2024 Winner Jennifer Guzman Millan - Vasquez Law Firm, PLLC

@graph.name: Fall 2024 Winner Jennifer Guzman Millan - Vasquez Law Firm, PLLC

content.h1: The Vasquez Law Firm DACA Dreamer Scholarship Winner
content.heroSection:
The Vasquez Law Firm DACA Dreamer Scholarship Winner

Fall 2024 Winner Jennifer Guzman Millan

Jennifer is a hardworking graduate student at the University of Michigan-Flint, where she is pursuing her doctorate in Occupational Therapy. We encourage you to read her beautiful poem, which illustrates her life as an ambitious immigrant student in search of her next opportunity.

Read Jennifer’s Poem

A Door of Opportunity

As an “illegal alien”, I am looking for a door

As the eldest child of her parents, I am looking for a door

As the oldest and only undocumented sibling, I am looking for a door

As an older sister who encourages her little sisters to surpass her, I am looking for a door

As one that has lived her whole life with many “firsts”, I am looking for a door

As the pillar of the family due to her language and educational skills, I am looking for a door

As one who was depended on and couldn’t ask for help growing up, I am looking for a door

As one who was rejected from many things due to her status, I am looking for a door

As one who always found something she was very qualified for but read “Must be US citizen”, I am looking for a door

As one who was told not to pursue higher education by educational professionals because of her status, I am looking for a door

As one whose undocumented parents always believed in her and are willing to work extra hard for their daughter to become a health professional one day, I am looking for a door

As one who carries the burden of always trying to prove that I belong here to others; and that I am a human with hopes, dreams, and aspirations, I am looking for a door

As a high-achieving student who completed all her education in the US, I am looking for a door

As someone who had many doors closed to her face and others not opened at all, I am looking for a door

As a proud Mexican-born student who has been putting triple the effort of others to hopefully one day be able to complete the last stage in her education, I am looking for a door

As someone who is very well deserving of a door, I will continue looking for a door
